values:
Yeah, sorry about that. D= So how are things going for everyone? I'm hoping well.

I'm slightly freaked out at the moment. My left hand is swollen and my wrist hurts. My wrist started hurting Monday and my hand started to swell up yesterday (possibly Monday night). Might go to the doctor to have it checked out, though I have a vague idea what it may be. Sorry, I'd never had anything like this happen before and I'm somewhat concerned.

Ahh, yes, a photography contest is coming up. I'm planning on entering just for the hell of it. I'm trying to decide two pictures from the list below. Tell me which ones are your favorite please. I also may submit Gaze (http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Gaze-68446528) under portraits.

Have a great life, everyone!

~Yuki


Over the Hills: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Over-the-Hills-44226705

Waterfall 2: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Waterfall-2-63161240

Chaos: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Chaos-63074958

Rock Creek: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Rock-Creek-1-63074252

Sunset: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Sunset-63066847

Cloud Hanging in the Sky: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Cloud-Hanging-in-the-Sky-63073322

Stream: http://yuki-sasaki.deviantart.com/art/Stream-63066555

Sure no one is going to read this anyway...

Hmm... guess I'm stuck in my hometown for one more year. I'd made the decision because it's cheaper to go ahead and take my core classes here than at the university I'd planned on going. Besides, why waste a substancial amount of money on classes you're required to take but has nothing to do with your major? I'm looking forward to beginning guitar, Japanese 3, and honors intro philosophy. Comp 1 not so much, I'd never been a big fan of English. Next semester I'm going to try to go into photography and ancient/med. history.
Well, I'm kinda wondering if the college will have Japanese 3. After all, by the time Japanese 2 was over with, we didn't have very many people in the class. Plus I know that two guys are going off to universities out of state (unless they changed their minds, then I'll question why the hell are they still here) and one is debating whether or not he's going into 3. However, if canceled, I'm going to take Russian. It's one of the other languages I want to learn and the only language I give a damn about that fits in my schedule (otherwise I would plan on taking Chinese). Hopefully that will not be the case.
But to be completely honest... I don't want to be here anymore. This town offers nothing at this point. I'm out of high school finally, now I want to leave. Through the majority of my life I felt as though that I'm out of place... that I was born in the wrong city. It's about to the point of insanity, but I'll tolerate a year. I just want that year to go by quickly. Once I'm out of this state, I'll only come back to visit the very few family members I care. If I stay here forever, I'll feel miserable for the rest of my life. Where would I like to go? Honestly, the place I feel the most comfortable is Los Angeles. However, I know I won't be able to pull something off immediately after getting out of college. Unless I meet at least one other person I know I can tolerate as a room mate, most likely I'll end up someplace preferably out of state but a cheap cost of living.
It's lovely when you have ambitious people living in towns such as the one I live in, or worse smaller. You have dreams you want to fulfill but you're so limited. My uncle, the one who's a musician, felt the same way when he lived here. He couldn't stand being here and he wasn't going anywhere with his music career by living here. It was fairly sad because he's a very talented drummer. I remember all through my younger childhood every time I went to my grandparent's house, he's back in the bedroom practicing for hours straight without stopping. Anyway, he moved out to California first living in La Mesa (San Diego area) then to Long Beach. After a while, he went out to LA along with a buddy of his. Now, he plays in two bands, one of the bands (STOP, REVOLT.) did a tour in March and is booking a tour for October. It's about bloody time, too. He has too great of talent to be wasted. Hopefully they will become fairly successful. To the point, he's really happy out there, he found his place meant for him.
I'm hoping I'll be able to actually get some rest tonight. All week it's been one of those things where you sleep but you don't actually get any rest. Not only waking up through the night but also been having nightmares. Heh, there's always benadryl to knock you out and pretty much not have any dreams. No minna, I'm not hooked. Anyway, I should get going. Might write some more (after all, seven pages are not enough) before going to sleep.

Goodbye for now.

For not coming here very often and responding to other posts.

Feeling rather odd... :shrug:

Hehe... this is silly. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dapfbbxvsho What are you waiting for, go check it out!

It's been a long time since I'd logged in.
So what's happen since the last time?  Well...
-I went to a Dir en grey concert last month and had an awesome time. Time to sound like a dork: I caught a water bottle cap one of the members tossed out. *shrug* Hey, better than nothing. Overall an excellent show and indeed a rock concert.
-I recently dyed my hair and it turned out a completely different color than I thought. Instead of red, I'm a pink hair now! >_<
-I'm going to Kansas City, Missouri Friday to see another rock concert. This time it's a band called Stop. Revolt! Check out their myspace page sometime, they're really good and a couple of odd individuals.

So yeah, pretty much not a whole lot is going on. Spring break is about to start so most likely I'm going to practice on the drums and guitar. Hope life is going well lately!

~Yuki

So I went to a football (soccer) game today. Once again, the team lost (not to my surprise) and there's this Italian guy with very thick eyebrows everyone on the team wanted to kick his ass. Going to another game tomorrow and hopefully the team will do fairly well. Though I'm wondering if I'll still be awake by the time the game is over (no, I'm not saying it's boring but more along the lines that the game starts really late).
So my birthday is tomorrow. What am I going to do? Just go out to eat with mi padre and that's pretty much it. The snag, my grandparents want all of us get together next week to celebrate (there's ice on the ground and it's supposed to snow tomorrow... seriously, around here that's a big deal and people don't know how to drive in these conditions). Just another typical day, no big deal.
Speaking of ice, thanks to the weather I had the entire week off of school. I don't care about high school but having time off of college is a rather unpleasant thought. Like I said, people around here don't know how to handle it. Heck, I'd never learned how to drive with ice on the roads. Now we (the high schools) have to make up the days since we used more snow days than we were given but that doesn't matter to me because a)I'm only taking two classes at the high school and b)I'm not going on vacation (as far as I know) during the summer to save up money for college.

Woo, happy birthday Die-san! <3

Came home about a half an hour ago. Had English and piano lab finals today. Aced both of them with no problems. Tomorrow I have statistics (which shouldn't be that hard), turned in my photography final but still have to go to class any way (-_-), and waved my physics final. Woo hoo!

I was talking to one of my friends in piano lab after playing our playing portion of the final (Christmas song) and she mentioned that she would like some sushi. We decided that after our third hour final we'll meet up in the commons, hang out with our friends who have to stay, then go to a Japanese restaurant for lunch. Yummy, yummy! So far only three of us are going.

I'm off! Hope everyone has a happy holiday. <3

Due to the increased demand, free-will America is pleased the announce that two additional tour dates have been added for Dir en grey's North American tour.
2/24/2007 - Los Angeles, CA at the Avalon
2/25/2007 - San Francisco, CA at The Filmore


Pre-order site: http://direngrey.tickets.musictoday.com/DirEnGrey/calendar.aspx
Free-Will America: http://www.free-will-america.com/portal/

Rapids Deep within my heart Lies the cold violent rapids Of sadistic dreams Yay, Thanksgiving break! Yesterday was the last day at my high school and the college takes the entire week off (thank god!). I really love Japanese, honestly, but it's nice not going. And yay to the fact that I woke up at 6:50 on a day off! Sadly, that is fairly late for me. -_-

Okay, I'm going to a Dir en grey concert in Texas. I was thinking of possibly giving gifts to each of the members. I know what I'm going to give to Kyo and Toshiya; I have a couple of ideas for Kaoru (but not quiet sure and kinda iffy). If you could, I would highly appreciate some suggestions for Kaoru, Die, and Shinya. 
Thank you very much! 

~Yuki

I dunno why I'm posting this... Yay, I'm bored!  >_<  This story is two years old and I really need to go back to edit some things.  I did this for my English class (writing portfolio) a few years ago.  For this one, the class had to pick three random numbers between 1 and 10.  I ended up with an alien taking place after a major thunderstorm and someone is about to give up.  And this is what I came up with!
Yes, I know it changes from past tense to present.  The main character first tells the story then moves on to what's going on at the time. I may have some grammatical errors, too.

<lj-cut text="The storm of hatred">


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For four months, here in the little costal village of Kilika, an interminable thunderstorm hit. At first it seemed like it was like any other storm that comes and goes. However, day-by-day, the storm continued on. Never were there any signs of the storm stopping. It continued growing and stayed in that state for some time.

The citizens of this village at first continued on their daily routines. As the days grew old and weeks flew by, worry started to grow among the humans. The flood planes filled up very quickly and became ponds. I swear that I had seen some people who loved fishing so much trying to fish out of the plane. Amazing such a horrible storm such as this will not stop them. Either they had mistaken it as a pond (most likely you would if you dont know the place very well) or they were very ignorant.

As the storm continued on more and more people stayed home; less and less people went out. There were some people hired by families to teach their children. Doctors started to go to the villagers domicile for medical reasons. Well the remaining ones who would go outside. Heck, some of the humans hired people that were more than willing to go outside so they could purchase necessities for them. Lets just say my parents were not one of them.

My younger sister, Usagi, and I still have to go to school. The number of students, teachers, and faculty slowly dropped. The teachers continued on with their lessons but as teachers left, we started to have nothing but free time. At first it was really cool but then it started to get boring. Usagi and I begged our parents to let us stay home but they always had answered the same thing every time. "Usagi and Kiyoshi, education is very important! Who cares about this storm! It is just a little rain!"

Little rain... ha! It was more than just a little rain. It was a lot of rain with a side of lightening. That would not get to mom and dad. No mater how many times we begged they will not allow us to stay home from school.

So most peoples lives started to become miserable. Including mine... I am not a people though... I am not human. I am different. I belong to a different race. I am... a freak.

After a week went by and the storm continued on, people started to look at me funny. Villagers shot glares at me as I walked down the street. I questioned why. Why were they glaring at me? I didnt do anything wrong. My answer came soon. As I walked to school with my younger sister one day, a middle-aged raven-haired woman and her son glared at me. The little boy shouted, "Go back to the mother ship!"

"Its all your fault that this storm is still here!" the woman cried out.

My fault? How was this storm my fault? I didnt call for this storm to come. Heck, I wanted the storm to go away! The insults and ranting continued on and on.

Now, a week after the four-month period of this storm, there is a big party. When the storm went by, I thought the insults would come to an end. Boy Im wrong. People still shout horrible comments at me. Now they are blaming me for damages and some other things. I... I dont care anymore.

No one cares about me. The villagers hate me. All of them hate me... My biological parents left me here. My own biological parents dont care for me!

I am now at the outskirts of the village. I look around to see if anyone is near by. I pull out a gun from my coat pocket. I take it off of safety and put the barrel of the weapon at the temple of my head. This is it... here we go. One... two...

"Kiyoshi!" a female voice cries out. Sigh... who is it? I turn around and Usagi is running towards me. I lower my hand down. What are you? She looks down at the gun and widens her stormy gray eyes. "Why do you...?"

"Have this gun?" I finish her sentence. "To end everything. The insults, the pain Im going to give up"

"Give up..." She gasps realizing what I am about to do. "Why are you going to kill yourself!?"

"No one wants me... no one cares. They want me dead..."

"Kiyoshi..."

"Youd heard the insults! The villagers wont care if I am no longer here! Theyll be happy actually! In fact most likely theyll celebrate my death! Bloody hell theyll make this day a holiday! Kiyoshi Death Day! They"

"Dont be silly!" she cries out. "The villagers were only being human this storm frightened them. They found this as an unnatural occurrence. They wanted to blame on someone something The xenophobic side took over them. This storm brought out the xenophobic side of them In their eyes you are different just not normal. So they started to blame you." She walks up to me now only inches away. "But I dont you are the same as everyone else. But, in a way, everyone is different. I do care for you Mom and Dad care about you. See, there are people who care." She looks down at the gun. "If you die I... I..." she starts bawling and hugs me tightly like if she doesn't hold on to me, I would disappear before her eyes.

I drop the gun. What was I thinking? I was being weak Usagi is right. I hug her in comfort. "Shhhh... its okay... I am not going anywhere. Ill be here."

She sniffles. "You... youre staying?"

"Yes, Usagi," I answer softly.

She hugs me tighter. I refuse to go... I still have a life ahead of me. I will not give up... I refuse to give up...
